newsitem.title: USA: U.S. senators propose estate tax reform bill.
newsitem.headline: U.S. senators propose estate tax reform bill.

text.p: Senate Majority Leader Trent Lott and a group of senators Wednesday proposed legislation that would reform the estate tax.
The bill would phase-in an increase of the exemption from the estate tax to $1 million from the current $600,000 over six years.

The measure would exempt $1.5 million of the assets of a family-owned business from the estate tax and 50 percent of the next $8.5 million, as long as the heirs continued to operate the business, the senators said. The legislation was sponsored by Republican and Democrat senators.
